mods.abstract: $25 REWARD. WILL be given to any person, who will arrest and deliver to me in Baton Rouge, or lodge in any Jail, the following described negro man, HINTON ; who disappeared on the evening of the 27th Nov., '55. It is supposed he may have left on the steamer C.D. Jr. where we has been lately employed. HINTON is about 27 yrs. of age, dark complexion, redish eyes, quick spoken, but always speaks low and generally has a sullen look, if questioned upon any subject, he invariable holds his tobacco on the end of his tongue while in the act of speaking, he is five feet, seven and a quarter inches high. H.V. Babin dec4-tf
mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries, Special Collections ( http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special )
mods.accessCondition: E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments about the collection.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
